MVAU Weight Memory Generator File (gen_mvau_weight_mem.py)

Author(s): Syed Asad Alam syed.as[xxx]ad.alam@tcd[xxx].ie

This file generates a single memory for weight storage. The depth of memory equals (KDim^2 * IFMCh * OFMCh) / (SIMD*PE) and the word length of each data equals SIMD * Weights Precision.

This material is based upon work supported, in part, by Science Foundation Ireland, www.sfi.ie under Grant No. 13/RC/2094_P2 and, in part, by the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under the Marie Sklodowska-Curie grant agreement Grant No.754489.

Functions
gen_mvau_weight_mem
def gen_mvau_weight_mem(
wmem_id
)

This function takes does the actual generation using a series of write commands. The use of Python generator was necessary so that file and module names of each memory are unique

Parameters
wmem_id

Unique ID for each memory, passed on from command line when generating memories. All other parameters are part of the SystemVerilog design space

Returns

None

parser
def parser()

This function defines an ArgumentParser object for command line arguments

Returns

Parser object (parser)

__main__
if __name__ == "__main__"

Entry point of the file, retrieves the command line arguments and calls the gen_mvau_weight_mem function with the required arguments
